com.myronmarston.music.scales
Class ChromaticScale

java.lang.Object
  com.myronmarston.music.scales.Scale
      com.myronmarston.music.scales.ChromaticScale
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class ChromaticScale
extends Scale

Chromatic Scale--a scale containing all 12 pitches. This scale does not have a true tonal center; instead, the key signature is set to C major just so we don't have any flats or sharps in our key signature and all notes will have their own accidentals.

Constructor Detail

ChromaticScale

public ChromaticScale()
               throws InvalidKeySignatureException
Constructor.

Throws:
InvalidKeySignatureException - should never be thrown but must be declared because the super class constructor can throw it

ChromaticScale

public ChromaticScale(NoteName keyName)
               throws InvalidKeySignatureException
We have some code that uses reflection to instantiate scales, passing the key name. All other scales have this constructor, so to make this one conform, we provide this one as well.

Parameters:
keyName - ignored
Throws:
InvalidKeySignatureException - should never be thrown
